name: Tokyo Skytree
description: A 634-meter tall broadcasting tower with an observation deck offering panoramic views of Tokyo.
price_of_entry:
Set Ticket (Observation Deck + Tembo Galleria):
• Weekday: Adults 3,500 yen, Students 2,350 yen, Children 1,450 yen
• Weekend: Adults 3,800 yen, Students 2,550 yen, Children 1,550 yen
Observation Deck Only:
• Weekday: Adults 2,400 yen, Students 1,550 yen, Children 950 yen
• Weekend: Adults 2,600 yen, Students 1,650 yen, Children 1,000 yen
open_hours:
Weekday: 10:00 - 22:00 (last entry at 21:00)
Weekend: 9:00 - 22:00 (last entry at 21:00)
general_advice: Try to book your ticket in advance to avoid long lines. Visit on a clear day for the best views.

name: Osaka Castle
description: Osaka Castle, built by Toyotomi Hideyoshi in the 16th century, is a historic site with a museum and observatory, surrounded by a park popular during cherry blossom season.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 1,200 yen
University/High school students: 600 yen (ID required)
Junior high and younger: Free (ID required).

closest_stations.station_name: Tanimachi 4-chome Station(Osaka Metro Tanimachi Line / Chuo Line)

general_advice: Wear comfortable shoes as the castle grounds are spacious. Visiting during cherry blossom season offers beautiful views. Arrive early to avoid crowds, especially on weekends and holidays.

name: Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium
description: Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium is one of Japan's largest and most popular aquariums, known for its massive Kuroshio Sea tank where whale sharks and manta rays swim majestically. Located within Ocean Expo Park, the aquarium features a variety of marine life from the waters surrounding Okinawa.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 2,180 yen
High school students: 1,440 yen
Children: 710 yen
Under 6: Free.
general_advice: The aquarium is located far from the city center, so using a rental car or taking a bus is convenient.

name: Ise Jingu
Description: Ise Jingu is one of Japan's most sacred Shinto shrines, dedicated to the sun goddess Amaterasu. Surrounded by peaceful forests, it consists of two main areas, Naiku and Geku. With over 2,000 years of history.
general_advice: Visit early in the morning for a quiet and spiritual experience. Wear comfortable shoes as the shrine grounds are large and involve walking. Photography is not allowed in certain sacred areas.

name: Fushimi Inari Taisha
description: Famous for its thousands of vermilion torii gates, this shrine is dedicated to the Shinto god of rice. It is one of Kyoto's most iconic sights.
general_advice: Be prepared for a long walk if you plan to reach the summit.

name: Mt. Fuji
description: Japan's highest mountain and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its iconic symmetrical cone and as a popular hiking destination.

closest_stations.walking_time_minutes: 2 minutes + Direct bus to Fujinomiya 5th Station available (~90 minutes)
5 minutes + Seasonal bus to Fujinomiya 5th Station (~120 minutes)
3 minutes + Bus to Fujinomiya area available (limited service)

closest_stations.station_name: Mishima Station(JR Tokaido Shinkansen / Izuhakone Railwa)
closest_stations.walking_time_minutes: 5 minutes + Seasonal bus service to Fujinomiya 5th Station

general_advice: Climb during official season for safety. Bring warm clothes and plenty of water. Consider staying overnight at a mountain hut for sunrise viewing.

name: Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
description: A Zen Buddhist temple in Kyoto famous for its beautiful golden exterior and reflection on the surrounding pond.
price_of_entry:
Adults (high school and above): 500 yen
Children (elementary/junior high): 300 yen
Under elementary: Free.
general_advice: Visit in the morning for the best lighting. The site can get very crowded during peak tourist season. No entry inside the pavilion.

name: Ginkaku-ji (Silver Pavilion)
description: A Zen temple in Kyoto officially known as Jisho-ji. Despite its name, the pavilion is not covered in silver but is admired for its elegant simplicity and beautiful moss garden.
price_of_entry:
Adults (high school and above): 500 yen
Children (elementary/junior high): 300 yen
Under elementary: Free.
general_advice: Take a walk along the Philosopher's Path after your visit. Morning visits are less crowded and provide a serene atmosphere.

name: Kiyomizu Temple
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site in Kyoto, famous for its wooden stage that juts out from the main hall, offering panoramic views of the city.
general_advice: Be prepared for a bit of uphill walking. Especially beautiful during cherry blossom and autumn seasons.

name: Himeji Castle
description: Japan's most spectacular surviving feudal-era castle, also known as the White Heron Castle. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
general_advice: Wear comfortable shoes, there are many stairs. Visit early to avoid long waits, especially during spring.

name: Shirakawa-go
description: A UNESCO World Heritage village known for its traditional gassho-zukuri thatched roof houses and beautiful snowy scenery.
general_advice: Stay overnight in a traditional inn if possible. Winter illumination is especially popular.

name: Tokyo Disneyland
description: A world-famous Disney theme park featuring classic attractions, parades, and seasonal events.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 7,900-10,900 yen, Junior/High school students: 6,600-9,000 yen.
Elementary and younger: 4,700-6,500 yen.
general_advice: Buy tickets online in advance. Check parade schedules. Expect crowds on weekends and holidays.

name: Universal Studios Japan
description: A theme park in Osaka offering rides and shows based on Hollywood movies, including attractions like Harry Potter and Minions.
general_advice: Buy Express Passes to skip long queues. Arrive early for popular rides.

name: Fuji-Q Highland
description: A thrill-seeker's amusement park near Mt. Fuji, known for its record-breaking roller coasters.
general_advice: Check weather before visiting. Some rides may be closed on windy days.

name: Huis Ten Bosch
description: A theme park in Nagasaki recreating a Dutch townscape with seasonal flower events and light shows.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 7,600 yen, Middle school students: 6,600 yen, Children: 5,000 yen.
Preschoolers: 3,800 yen, Seniors: 5,900 yen.
general_advice: Stay until evening to enjoy the illuminations. Try Dutch-themed food and sweets.

name: Nagashima Spa Land
description: A large amusement park in Mie Prefecture featuring roller coasters, a water park, and hot spring facilities.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 5,800 yen, Elementary students: 4,400 yen.
Infants: 2,700 yen, Seniors: 2,900 yen.
general_advice: Buy combo tickets for the amusement park and hot spring area. Avoid peak summer weekends.

name: Yomiuriland
description: An amusement park in Tokyo known for its winter illuminations and water park in summer.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 5,800 yen
Junior/High school students: 4,600 yen
Elementary students: 4,000 yen
Preschoolers: 2,400 yen.
general_advice: Visit in winter for spectacular lights. Buy tickets online for discounts.

name: Tobu World Square
description: A theme park in Tochigi featuring miniature replicas of famous buildings from around the world.
general_advice: Great for kids and photo lovers. Allow 2–3 hours to explore.

name: Enoshima Aquarium
description: A modern aquarium near the beach in Kanagawa with jellyfish tanks, dolphin shows, and marine life exhibits.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 2,800 yen
Students: 1,800 yen
Students: 1,300 yen
Students: 1,300 yen
Preschoolers: 900 yen.
general_advice: Visit in the morning to enjoy sea views and avoid crowds. Great for families with kids.

name: Ishigaki Island
description: A tropical island in Okinawa known for its stunning beaches, coral reefs, and rich Ryukyuan culture. Popular for snorkeling and diving.

closest_stations.walking_time_minutes: Car or bus required to reach beaches

general_advice: Renting a car is the most convenient way to explore. Try local dishes like Ishigaki beef and Yaeyama soba.

name: Enoshima
description: A small island near Kamakura known for its beaches, shrines, observation tower, and sea caves. Popular as a day trip from Tokyo.
general_advice: Visit on weekdays to avoid crowds. Try Enoshima specialties like shirasu-don and explore the caves if weather permits.

name: Tashirojima (Cat Island)
description: An island in Miyagi Prefecture famous for its large population of friendly cats. Known as a 'cat paradise' and loved by animal lovers.
general_advice: No accommodations on the island, so plan for a day trip. Do not feed or scare the cats. Bring your own food and drinks.

name: Awaji Island
description: A large island in Hyogo Prefecture connected by the Akashi Kaikyo Bridge. Known for its natural beauty, hot springs, and fresh seafood.

closest_stations.station_name: Maiko Station + bus via Akashi Kaikyo Bridge

general_advice: Great destination for driving trips. Don't miss Awaji beef and onion-based dishes. Visit Naruto whirlpools nearby.

name: Tokyo Tower
description: A 333-meter red-and-white communications tower in Tokyo offering panoramic views, shops, and attractions.
price_of_entry:
Main Deck: Adults 1,500 yen, High school students 1,200 yen, Children 900 yen, Preschoolers 600 yen.
Top Deck Tour: Adults 3,500 yen, High school students 3,300 yen, Children 2,300 yen, Preschoolers 1,700 yen.
open_hours:
Main Deck: 09:00 - 23:00 (last entry at 22:30)
Top Deck Tour: 09:00 - 22:45 (last entry at 22:15)
general_advice: Visit around sunset for a great city view.

name: Shibuya Scramble Crossing
description: One of the busiest pedestrian crossings in the world, symbolizing modern Tokyo with neon lights and vibrant crowds.
general_advice: Best viewed from above try cafes in nearby buildings. Great photo spot at night.

name: Odaiba
description: A man-made island in Tokyo Bay known for entertainment, shopping malls, scenic views, and futuristic architecture.
general_advice: Ideal for a full-day visit. Don't miss teamLab Planets, shopping, and sunset by the Rainbow Bridge.

name: Dotonbori
description: A lively district in Osaka famous for neon lights, street food like takoyaki and okonomiyaki, and the Glico running man sign.
general_advice: Perfect for street food lovers. Best enjoyed at night when the signs are lit.

name: Umeda Sky Building
description: A futuristic skyscraper in Osaka with a rooftop Floating Garden Observatory offering 360-degree city views.
general_advice: Come in the evening for night views. Basement features a retro-style food alley.

name: Nagoya Castle
description: One of Japan's most important castles, originally built in the early Edo period. Famous for its golden shachihoko ornaments.
general_advice: Visit in spring for cherry blossoms. Reconstruction of the main keep is underway, so check access information in advance.

name: Nakasu
description: Fukuoka's largest nightlife district, known for its riverside yatai (food stalls), bars, and entertainment.
general_advice: Try Hakata ramen from street stalls. Be aware that some nightlife venues have cover charges.

name: Sapporo Clock Tower
description: One of the oldest Western-style buildings in Hokkaido, symbolizing Sapporo's early development. Now a small museum.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 350 yen
Students: 150 yen (student ID required)
High School And Below: Free (student ID required) yen.
general_advice: A quick visit with good photo opportunities.

name: Arashiyama
description: A scenic district in western Kyoto known for its bamboo grove, riverside views, temples, and traditional atmosphere.
general_advice: Visit early in the morning to enjoy the bamboo grove without crowds. Don't miss the Togetsukyo Bridge and Tenryu-ji Temple.

name: Kamikochi
description: A scenic mountain valley in the Northern Japan Alps, known for its clear river, alpine scenery, and hiking trails.
general_advice: Private cars are not allowed into Kamikochi. Use the shuttle bus. Early morning hikes offer the best views and fewer crowds.

name: Tsukiji Outer Market
description: A lively food and wholesale market in Tokyo, famous for its fresh seafood, street food, and Japanese kitchenware.
general_advice: Go early for the freshest offerings. Many shops are closed on Sundays and holidays. Try sushi, tamagoyaki, and grilled seafood.

name: Nara Park
description: A large park in Nara where you can interact with freely roaming deer.
general_advice: Buy deer crackers to feed the deer, but be cautious—they can get pushy

name: Mt Koya (Koyasan)
description: A sacred mountain in Wakayama and the center of Shingon Buddhism. Offers temple lodging and spiritual experiences.

closest_stations.station_name: Gokurakubashi Station + cable car to Koyasan Station

general_advice: Stay overnight at a temple (shukubo) for a unique Buddhist experience. Be respectful of religious customs.

name: Ginzan Onsen
description: A picturesque hot spring town in Yamagata known for its historic Taisho-era buildings and romantic atmosphere, especially in winter.
general_advice: Stay overnight in a traditional ryokan. Ideal for winter visits with snow-covered scenery.

name: Nikko Toshogu Shrine
description: A lavishly decorated shrine dedicated to Tokugawa Ieyasu. Famous for its 'Three Wise Monkeys' and rich carvings.
general_advice: Allow plenty of time to explore the entire shrine complex. Best during autumn foliage.

name: Itsukushima Shrine (Miyajima)
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site located on Miyajima Island. Famous for its torii gate that appears to float at high tide.
general_advice: Check tide times to see the torii gate at its most picturesque.

name: Harajuku & Omotesando
description: A vibrant Tokyo district blending youth fashion culture in Harajuku with upscale shopping in Omotesando.
general_advice: Explore Takeshita Street for unique fashion, then stroll Omotesando for architecture and high-end brands.

name: Nakano Broadway
description: A shopping complex in Tokyo known as a paradise for anime, manga, and pop culture enthusiasts.
general_advice: Ideal for collectors. Many hidden shops on upper floors.

name: Kobe Harborland
description: A scenic waterfront district in Kobe with shopping, dining, and a romantic night view. Popular for couples and families.
general_advice: Visit at sunset or night for beautiful illumination. Great dining options with harbor views.

name: Minato Mirai
description: A waterfront urban area in Yokohama known for its night view, shopping, dining, and attractions.
open_hours:
Shops:
  • Monday-Thursday: 10:00 - 20:00
  • Friday-Sunday & Holidays: 10:00 - 21:00
Restaurants: 11:00 - 23:00 (daily)
Food Court (4F):
  • Monday-Thursday: 10:00 - 20:00
  • Friday-Sunday & Holidays: 10:00 - 21:00
Cinema (5F): 09:00 - 23:00 (daily)
general_advice: Visit at night for the best views. The area is great for couples and families.

name: Roppongi Hills
description: A luxury urban complex in central Tokyo known for shopping, fine dining, art museums, and city views from Mori Tower.
general_advice: Great for an evening stroll, art, and a rooftop city view.

name: Susukino
description: The largest entertainment district in Hokkaido, known for its nightlife, izakayas, ramen, and neon lights.
general_advice: Try miso ramen and fresh seafood. Be aware of busy weekend crowds.

name: Hakodate Morning Market
description: A popular seafood market in Hokkaido offering fresh seafood bowls, grilled fish, and local produce.
general_advice: Go early for the best selection. Try the live squid fishing experience.

name: Izumo Taisha
description: One of the oldest and most important Shinto shrines in Japan, famous for en-musubi (marriage bonds).
price_of_entry:
Temple: Free
Treasure_Hall - Adult: 300 yen
Treasure_Hall - Student: 200 yen
Treasure_Hall - Elementary School Students And Junior High School Student: 100 yen.
general_advice: Visit with a respectful attitude. Many people come here to pray for love and connection.

name: Yakushima
description: A subtropical island in Kagoshima Prefecture known for its ancient cedar forests and biodiversity. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

closest_stations.station_name: Yakushima Airport / Miyanoura Port (access by air or ferry)

general_advice: Wear proper hiking gear and be prepared for rain. Great for multi-day trekking and nature photography.

name: Asakusa
description: A historic district in Tokyo famous for Senso-ji Temple, Kaminarimon Gate, and Nakamise shopping street.
open_hours:
Sensoji Main Hall:
  • April-September: 06:00 - 17:00
  • October-March: 06:30 - 17:00
Nakamise Shops: 08:00 - 17:00~20:30

closest_stations.station_name: Asakusa Station (Tokyo Metro Ginza Line, Toei Asakusa Line)

general_advice: Visit early to enjoy the temple without crowds. Great spot for traditional snacks and souvenirs.

name: Oarai Isosaki Shrine (Kamiiso no Torii)
description: A seaside shrine in Ibaraki known for its torii gate standing dramatically on a rock in the ocean.
general_advice: Best viewed at sunrise. Be careful on slippery rocks when approaching for photos.

name: Meiji Jingu
description: A major Shinto shrine in Tokyo dedicated to Emperor Meiji and Empress Shoken, surrounded by a lush forest in the heart of the city.

closest_stations.station_name: Harajuku Station (JR Yamanote Line) / Meiji-Jingumae Station (Tokyo Metro)

general_advice: Visit early morning for a peaceful experience. Great spot for a quiet walk and traditional shrine rituals.

name: Kaiyukan Aquarium
description: One of the largest public aquariums in the world, located in Osaka, featuring marine life from the Pacific Rim.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 2,700 - 3,500 yen
Children: 1,400 - 1,800 yen
Preschoolers: 700 - 900 yen.
general_advice: Buy tickets online to avoid queues. Great for families and marine lovers.

name: Gran Green Osaka
description: A large urban park and complex next to Osaka Station featuring lush lawns, fountains, shops, restaurants and a hotel.
general_advice: Great for picnic, shopping and food. Popular spot since opening 2024.

name: Tenjinbashisuji Shopping Street
description: At ~2.6 km, Japan's longest shopping arcade—with shops, eateries, local vibe, and Osaka Tenmangu Shrine nearby.
general_advice: Enjoy food, shopping and shrine visit. Try street food and stand-up bars

name: Osaka Tenmangu Shrine
description: A historic shrine founded in 949, dedicated to the god of learning Sugawara no Michizane. Hosts the Tenjin Festival.
general_advice: Visit during Tenjin Matsuri in July for a lively festival.

name: Kuromon Market
description: A lively market known for fresh seafood, street food, and traditional Osaka cuisine.
general_advice: Bring cash, as many vendors may not accept cards. Try the grilled scallops and wagyu skewers.

name: America village
description: A youthful, trendy neighborhood with fashion boutiques, vintage stores, cafes, and street art.
general_advice: Best visited in the afternoon or early evening for lively atmosphere. Great place for unique street fashion.

name: Expo 2025 Osaka Kansai
description: A global exposition scheduled to be held in Osaka's Yumeshima Island, showcasing innovations in health, technology, and sustainability.
price_of_entry:
Weekday Ticket: Adults 3,500 yen, Youth 3,500 yen, Children 1,500 yen.
Night Ticket: Adults 3,700 yen, Youth 2,000 yen, Children 1,000 yen.
One Day Ticket: Adults 7,500 yen, Youth 4,200 yen, Children 1,800 yen.
general_advice: Check the official website for the latest updates and ticket information as the event approaches.

name: Solaniwa Onsen Osaka Bay Tower
description: A large onsen theme park with traditional Japanese-style baths, food, and entertainment.
general_advice: Tattoos may need to be covered. Bring a change of clothes if you plan to stay for several hours.

name: Abeno Harukas
description: Japan's tallest skyscraper with an observation deck, department store, art museum, and hotel.
price_of_entry:
Adults: 2,000 yen
Junior High And High School: 1,200 yen
Elementary School: 700 yen
Preschool: 500 yen
Under 4: Free.
general_advice: Visit in the late afternoon to catch both day and night views. Try the rooftop café for a relaxing break.

name: Expo '70 Commemorative Park
description: A spacious park built on the site of the 1970 World Expo, featuring the famous Tower of the Sun and beautiful seasonal gardens.
general_advice: Plan at least half a day. Ideal for picnics, walking, and visiting the Tower of the Sun museum.

name: Sumiyoshi Taisha Shrine
description: One of Japan's oldest Shinto shrines, known for its unique architectural style and sacred arched bridge.
general_advice: Visit early to avoid crowds. Photography is allowed but be respectful of worshippers.

name: Osaka Korean Town
description: A vibrant area filled with Korean restaurants, shops, and cultural goods, reflecting the local Korean community.
general_advice: Try Korean street food like hotteok and tteokbokki. Weekends can be crowded.

name: Tennoji Zoo
description: One of Japan's oldest zoos, home to over 1,000 animals including lions, elephants, and koalas.
general_advice: Bring a hat in summer. Combine with a visit to nearby Shinsekai and Tsutenkaku.

name: Spa World
description: A massive hot spring theme park with themed baths from different countries, including Rome and Finland.
price_of_entry:
With Pool:
• Weekday: Adults 2,000 yen, Children 1,200 yen
• Weekend/Holiday: Adults 2,500 yen, Children 1,500 yen
Without Pool: Adults 1,500 yen, Children 1,000 yen.
general_advice: Some areas are gender-separated and rotate monthly. Tattoos must be covered.

name: Tsutenkaku Tower
description: A landmark observation tower in the Shinsekai district, offering panoramic views and nostalgic atmosphere.
general_advice: Visit at night for neon lights. Look for the Billiken statue for good luck!
